snippet: Water cutbacks for drought-stricken farmers and cities will be eased somewhat, due to recent rain and snow, officials announced Friday.
abstract: California Department of Water Resources announces it is increasing water allotments from the State Water Project, from zero to 5 percent of what water districts have requested, in effort to ease drought-stricken farmers and cities in state.
lead_paragraph: Water cutbacks for drought-stricken farmers and cities will be eased somewhat, due to recent rain and snow, officials announced Friday.

headline.main: California: A Little More Water Will Flow
headline.print_headline: California: A Little More Water Will Flow
